text: In telecommunication, release time is the time interval for a circuit to respond when an enabling signal is discontinued, for example: #in an automatic gain control or echo suppressor circuit, the time interval between the end of the enabling signal and the instant at which suppression ceases, #for a relay, the time between when the coil is de-energized, and the instant that contact closure ceases or is established. ==References== * Category:Telecommunication theory
title: Release time (telecommunication)
